text: Will js module eventually appear under "Theme Modules" in the editor?

Currently, JS Modules are not built as part of a theme, and so are not considered "Theme Modules".

In the future we do hope to have a unified "CMS Theme Project" experience where a theme which has "tranditional" HubL based modules/templates etc AND JS Building blocks would be built/deployed together. In that world JS Modules would be associated with that theme.
sounds like it's not going to happen but it would be nice to have the option to show them under "Theme Modules" before then
or maybe show them in some kind of unique way
It's a fair request, and I certainly appreciate the use case. I can't promise anything there but we will review it. And thank you for again for continuing to push on these features.

<@UAYBXDG4U> it would be amazing if the "future vision" theme could be easily converted from a standard theme. I'm imagining a scenario where I'll have to rebuild my site to take advantage of those features/processes but I don't foresee a major redesign of our site for years.
In the end I'll take the progress over easy conversion but I'm pre-stressed :laughing:

> it would be amazing if the “future vision” theme could be easily converted from a standard theme.
Do you think being able to incrementally add JS modules & partials to an existing theme solves ^ need? Or are you looking/hoping for something that (attempts?) to port as much HubL code to React components as possible?
the incremental solution solves the need
I feel like there would be "project" features that I would be missing out on though
and having just 1 tailwind config across everything would be ideal
right now my main project has a tailwind config and each project has it's own setup
Oh yes, that is good point that I totally didn’t think of (:face_with_hand_over_mouth:). Like a conversion of a existing theme to a project-based theme.
